block.p: Christine Carol Innerst and Dr. Richard George Webby were married yesterday by the Rev. Charles W. McCulloh Jr. at Trinity United Methodist Church in York, Pa. The Rev. Dr. John E. Morgan, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Webby, 29, is the senior director of tour marketing for the Elektra Entertainment Group at Time Warner in New York, where she oversees marketing and the promotion of touring musicians. She graduated cum laude from the University of Maryland at College Park.

Christine Carol Innerst and Dr. Richard George Webby were married yesterday by the Rev. Charles W. McCulloh Jr. at Trinity United Methodist Church in York, Pa. The Rev. Dr. John E. Morgan, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Webby, 29, is the senior director of tour marketing for the Elektra Entertainment Group at Time Warner in New York, where she oversees marketing and the promotion of touring musicians. She graduated cum laude from the University of Maryland at College Park.

She is a daughter of Carol and Preston Innerst of York. Her father, now retired, was the senior deputy managing editor of The Washington Times. Her mother, a freelance education writer, retired as the national education writer for The Washington Times.

Dr. Webby, 32, is the vice president for engineering at Savos Inc., a New York company that plans to provide wireless Internet services. He graduated from the University of New South Wales in Australia, where he also received a Ph.D. in information systems.

He is a son of Dr. Elizabeth Webby and Dr. Barry Webby of Sydney, Australia. His mother is the chairwoman of Australian literature at the University of Sydney and a fellow of the Australian Academy of the Humanities. His father is a research fellow in earth sciences at Macquarie University in Sydney.
